ems_near_10_median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest emergency medical services facilities. Facility location data were collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computer using Open Source Routing Machine (looking at roads for 2021) Geographies: Block group (12), Census tract (11), County (5), Civic Associations (51013_ca)
ems_near_10_median.long_name: Emergency medical services availability by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
ems_near_10_median.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest emergency medical service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

ems_cnt.long_description: Count of emergency medical services facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Geographies: Block group (12), Census tract (11), County (5), Civic Associations (51013_ca)
ems_cnt.long_name: Availability of emergency medical services by count
ems_cnt.statement: There are {value} emergency medical services facilities in {features.name}.

ems_3sfca.long_description: Emergency medical services availability is based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined as the demand for facilities (or the adult population). Geographies: Block group (12), Census tract (11), County (5), Civic Associations (51013_ca)
ems_3sfca.long_name: Emergency medical services geographic availability (3-step floating catchment areas)
ems_3sfca.statement: The emergency medical services availability for {features.name} is {value}.

lou04.title: Using a gis-based floating catchment method to assess areas with shortage of physicians

lou09.title: An enhanced two-step floating catchment area (e2sfca) method for measuring spatial accessibility to primary care physicians

lou03.title: Measures of spatial accessibility to health care in a gis environment: synthesis and a case study in the Chicago region
lou03.journal: Environment and Planning B: Planning and Design

saxon20.title: An Open Software Environment to Make Spatial Access Metrics More Accessible
saxon20.journal: University of Chicago: Center for Spatial Data Science
